title: Iran Protests Subside After Deadly Crackdown and Mass Arrests
snippets: Iran protests abate after deadly crackdown, residents and rights group say Reuters

Iran's deadly crackdown appears to have broadly quelled protests for now, according to a rights group and residents, as state media reported more arrests on Friday in the shadow of U.S. threats to intervene if the killing continues.

“There is massive disappointment and disillusionment,” one Tehran resident said. A human rights group acknowledged that demonstrations had been subdued since Sunday, with thousands of people detained.

title: Phillies Re Sign J.T. Realmuto to Three Year
snippets: The Phillies traded for Realmuto ahead of the 2019 season

J.T. Realmuto is staying in Philadelphia. The catcher re-signed with the Phillies on a three-year, $45-million deal on Friday, per multiple reports . The deal keeps Realmuto with the Phillies for an eighth straight season. Realmuto, 34, slashed .257/.315/.384 with 12 home runs over 134 games for the Phillies in 2025. Originally drafted by the Marlins, Realmuto joined the Phillies in 2018 after five seasons in Miami. Realmuto was an NL all-star with the Phillies in 2019 and 2021.
